title: Calories in Canned Green Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in canned green beans per 100 g serving, including carbs, fiber, protein, sodium, and quick preparation tweaks for better nutrition.
assumptions: Drained solids from standard canned green beans; includes brine effects; no added fats or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sodium level, packing liquid, and draining method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of drained canned green beans provides ~22 kcal and ~2 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Saut√©ed with 1 tsp butter per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in canned green beans per serving?
faqs.a: About 22 kcal per 100 g drained; a typical 1/2 cup serving is similar.

faqs.q: Are canned green beans high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, ~235 mg per 100 g; opt for low-sodium or rinse to reduce.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in canned green beans?
faqs.a: Around 1.8 g per 100 g, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Do canned green beans have added sugars?
faqs.a: Typically 2.1 g per 100 g from natural sources; check labels for sweetened varieties.

faqs.q: How do canned vs. fresh green beans compare nutritionally?
faqs.a: Canned have similar calories but higher sodium; fresh offer more vitamins if not overcooked.
